Articles.Content:
So...

I was playing 0.10.1 recently (the first currently available version for OSX) and could NOT get to orbit with stock parts! The lack of RCS and radial liquid boosters makes things a lot more difficult.

The challenge:

Get to a stable orbit around Kerbin in Kerbal Space Program version 0.10.1 or earlier.

Rules:

Stock parts ONLY

Craft must deorbit

Craft must make 1 full kerbin orbit, or pass over KSC twice

Craft must land in the ocean to explore the lack of correct water physics! No Soviet-style landings!

Uh, I did all of that back in .8 and .9. It's really not all that hard, aside from needing to consult a chart to see if your orbit is stable (rather than just looking at the map view).

Do you want me to do it again? Post the pictures I took back then? Or just take my word for it?

(My crowning achievement in those days was leaving them up there for 8 hours or so - sixteen orbits, at about 30 minutes per - while I went to work. This was before time acceleration, remember.)
I donÃ‚Â´t know how much different 0.13 is from 0.10, but 0.13 was my first version in which i learned not only to orbit, but also landed on Mun (using fins as legs hadnÃ‚Â´t been invented yet)
could you link the thread with the old downloadable versions? I can't seem to find it anymore.
0.10.1! Ah those days, where making your spacecraft orbit "Kearth" is already enough to consider you a pro in this game
Link pls, as NOONE else would still have a version that was older than the old demo just sitting around (apart from the devs maybe)

Yeah, I'm with Kahlzun on this one. There's little number of players who actually kept the previous versions on their drives for this challenge to be considered feasible. I didn't get KSP until .19 so, the only ways for me to get that is to either beg someone who does have it or pirate it. Honestly, I'd rather just pass on this challenge completely than do either of those...
Didn't Squad introduce the option for users to download older version? I haven't tried it myself so I don't know how far back you can go.
If they did, I have not a clue on how to do it... nor would I really use it since I honestly don't have a lot of space for it.
All versions before 0.13(.3?) are free. The demo became 0.13.3.

If they did, I have not a clue on how to do it... nor would I really use it since I honestly don't have a lot of space for it.

Here's the blog post about it.

NVM, just noticed it's for THE previous stable release, not all of them.

Here ya go, sorry it took forever:

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/24858-Old-versions-of-KSP-%28some-versions-still-wanted!%29

Thank sal for the link

Here ya go, sorry it took forever:

The 0.10.1 download link in there isn't working.

Any other sources for 0.10.1 ?

The 0.10.1 download link in there isn't working.

Any other sources for 0.10.1 ?

Works for me.

Edit: It's just downloading reeeally sloooowly. Once the download finishes for me, I'll re-upload it to MediaFire.

Edit again: Whoops, didn't realize that you probably meant the Windows version of 0.10.1. The Mac version works, anyway. >_>

If a Mac guy/gal wants to try this, here's a much speedier download: http://www./download/ggby672inlgzzaz/KSP_osx_0_10_1.zip

Edited June 8, 2013 by DannySwish
Yeah it's the windows version I'm after. I'll have a go at this one if I find a copy of it around.

no map view, no time warp, no anything... you guys had it rough back in the days!

at least there was an awesome beach with palms and stuff where Kerbals could chill out
